Intercede for us with your Lord. Do you not see what we are in? He will say: Indeed, my Lord has become angry today with an anger the likes of which He has never been angry before and will never be angry after. Indeed, I killed a soul I was not commanded to kill. Myself, myself, myself. Go to someone else; go to Jesus. They will go to Jesus and say: O Jesus, you are the Messenger of Allah and His Word which He directed to Mary and a Spirit from Him. You spoke to people in the cradle. Intercede for us with your Lord. Do you not see what we are in? Jesus will say: Indeed, my Lord has become angry today with an anger the likes of which He has never been angry before and will never be angry after. He will not mention a sin. Go to Muhammad, peace and blessings be upon him.' In a narration: 'So they will come to me and say: O Muhammad, you are the Messenger of Allah and the Seal of the Prophets. Allah has forgiven you your past and future sins. Intercede for us with your Lord. Do you not see what we are

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: in? So I will go and come under the Throne and fall prostrate for my Lord. Then Allah will open for me of His praises and the beauty of extolling Him what He has not opened for anyone before me. Then it will be said: O Muhammad, raise your head. Ask, and you will be given; intercede, and your intercession will be accepted. So I will raise my head and say: My Ummah (nation), O Lord! My Ummah, O Lord! My Ummah, O Lord! He will say: O Muhammad, admit from your nation those who have no account upon them from the right gate of the gates of Paradise, and they will share with the people in all other gates. Then he said: By the One in whose hand is my soul, the distance between the two door panels of the gates of Paradise is like the distance between Mecca and Hajar, or like the distance between Mecca and Busra.' In the two Sahihs: 'Seventy thousand of my nation will enter Paradise without account. They are those who do not seek Ruqyah (incantations), do not believe in omens, do not use branding (cauterization), and rely upon their Lord.' In a narration in Sahih Muslim: 'Seventy thousand, with every one of them seventy thousand.' He said in Al-Mafatih: 'Tawakkul (reliance) is of two types: Special, which is to abandon medical treatment, Ruqyah, and branding due to extreme trust that nothing will befall him except what Allah has written for him of benefit and harm, and this is what is intended here. And General, which is obligatory upon all, which is to know that there is no influencer except Allah; food does not satisfy and medicines do not cure except by His command. Whoever holds this belief, it is permissible for him to seek medical treatment and Ruqyah, and to earn wealth through trade and crafts.'

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: The Account (Reckoning). Allah Almighty said: (And Paradise will be brought near to the righteous. And Hellfire will be brought forth for the deviators. And it will be said to them, 'Where are those you used to worship? Other than Allah? Can they help you or help themselves?' So they will be overturned into Hellfire, they and the deviators. And the soldiers of Iblees, all together.) And Allah Almighty said: (Then We will surely question those to whom [the message] was sent, and We will surely question the messengers. Then We will surely relate [their deeds] to them with knowledge, and We were never absent.) In Sahih Muslim from Shaqiq bin Abdullah, the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: 'Hell will be brought on the Day of Resurrection having seventy thousand reins; with every rein are seventy thousand angels dragging it.' In Sahih Al-Bukhari: 'Noah will be brought on the Day of Resurrection and it will be said: Did you convey? He will say: Yes, O Lord. Then his nation will be asked: Did he convey to you? They will say: No warner came to us. It will be said: Who are your witnesses? He will say: Muhammad and his nation. The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: So you will be brought and you will testify. Then the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, recited: (And thus we have made you a just community) He said: Just (Adool), (That you will be witnesses over the people and the Messenger will be a witness over you.)' Muqatil said regarding His saying: (And stand apart today, you criminals): meaning isolate yourselves today, i.e., in the Hereafter, from the righteous. Al-Suddi said: Be aside. In the two Sahihs, the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: 'Allah will say: O Adam, stand up and send forth the mission of the Fire. He will say: At Your service and obeying You, and all good is in Your Hands. What is the mission of the Fire? He will say: From every thousand'

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: nine hundred and ninety-nine. He said: At that time, the young child will turn grey, every pregnant female will drop her load, and you will see the people as if they are drunk, but they are not drunk; but the punishment of your Lord is severe.' This was very hard on them, so they said: 'O Messenger of Allah, where is that man (the one saved)?' The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: 'Nine hundred and ninety-nine from Gog and Magog, and one from you.' The people said: 'Allahu Akbar.' The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: 'By Allah, I hope that you will be a quarter of the people of Paradise. By Allah, I hope that you will be a third of the people of Paradise. By Allah, I hope that you will be half of the people of Paradise.' The people said Takbir. The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: 'You are not among the people on that Day except like a white hair on a black bull, or like a black hair on a white bull.' In Sahih Muslim, the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: 'You will surely restore rights to their owners, until retribution is taken for the hornless sheep from the horned sheep.' Al-Kalbi said: 'Allah Almighty will say to the cattle, wild beasts, birds, and predators: Be dust. And He will flatten the earth with them. At that, the disbeliever will wish that he were dust, as per the saying of Allah Almighty: (And the disbeliever will say, 'Oh, I wish that I were dust.')' In the book of Tirmidhi and others from Abu Barzah Al-Aslami, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: 'The feet of a servant will not move on the Day of Resurrection from before Allah Almighty until he is asked about four things: About his life and in what he spent it; about his body and in what he used it; about his knowledge and what he did with it; and about his wealth, from where he earned it and in what he spent it.' In Sahih Muslim from Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: We were with the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, and he laughed. He said: 'Do you know why I laugh?' We said: Allah and His Messenger know best. He said: 'From the servant's addressing his Lord. He says: O Lord, did You not protect me from injustice? He says: Yes. He says: I do not allow a witness against myself except from myself. He says: Sufficient is your own self against you this Day as a reckoner, and the noble scribes as witnesses. He said: So his mouth is sealed, and it is said to his limbs: Speak. He said: So they speak of his deeds. Then he is allowed to speak again. He says: Away with you and destruction to you! It was for you that I was arguing.' In the two Sahihs from Adi bin Hatim, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: 'There is none of you except that his Lord will speak to him, with no interpreter between him and his Lord. He will look to his right and see nothing

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: except what he put forth. He will look to his left and see nothing except what he put forth. And he will look in front of him and see nothing except the Fire facing him. So fear the Fire, even with half a date.' In the two Sahihs from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: 'Whoever is held to account on the Day of Resurrection will be punished.' I said: Did Allah Almighty not say: (He will be judged with an easy account)? He said: 'That is not the Account (Hisab); that is only the Presentation (Al-Ard). Whoever is debated in the Account on the Day of Resurrection will be punished.' So reflect, may Allah have mercy on you, on your Lord's questioning of you without an intermediary about every little and large thing, every speck and date-stone skin, and the saying of the angels: 'O So-and-so, come to the Standing Place.' It has been narrated from him, peace be upon him: 'Indeed, Allah has an angel, the distance between whose eyelids is a journey of one hundred years.' So what do you think of yourself when you witness such angels sent to you to take you to the place of Presentation? Your muscles will tremble, your limbs will shake, and you will wish to be taken to Hell rather than have your shameful deeds presented to your Lord Almighty. Imagine yourself in the hands of those appointed over you until they bring you to the Throne of the Most Merciful. They throw you from their hands, and Allah Almighty calls you with His Great Speech: 'O Son of Adam, come near to Me.' So you draw near with a beating, sorrowful, fearful heart and a humbled, abased gaze. You are given your book which leaves out nothing small or great but that it has enumerated it. I wonder with what foot you will stand before Allah, with what tongue you will answer, and with what heart you will comprehend what you say and what you are told? If He says: 'Were you not shy of Me? Did you think that I did not see you?' From Al-Fudayl: 'I do not envy being a drawn-near angel, nor a sent prophet, nor a righteous servant. Are these not held accountable in the Resurrection? I only envy the one who was never created.' Some recited: Represent your standing on the Day of Gathering naked... Seeking favor, anxious of heart, confused. / The Fire roars from rage and anger... At the sinners, and you meet the Lord angry. / Read your book, O My servant, slowly... And look at it to see if what happened, happened?

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: When you read a book that leaves out not... A letter for me, nor what was in secret or public. / The Majestic One says: Take him, O My angels... Pass with My servant to the Fires, thirsty. / O Lord, do not grieve us on the Day of Account, nor... Give anyone authority over us on that Day.

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: Section on the Scale (Mizan). Allah Almighty said: (The Striking Calamity (1) What is the Striking Calamity? (2) And what can make you know what is the Striking Calamity? (3) It is the Day when people will be like moths, dispersed, (4) And the mountains will be like wool, fluffed up. (5) Then as for one whose scales are heavy [with good deeds], (6) He will be in a pleasant life. (7) But as for one whose scales are light, (8) His refuge will be an abyss. (9) And what can make you know what that is? (10) It is a Fire, intensely hot. (11)) Abu Bakr Al-Bazzar, may Allah be pleased with him, mentioned from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, he said: 'An angel is appointed over the Scale. The son of Adam is brought and made to stand between the two pans of the Scale. If his scale is heavy, the angel calls out with a voice that all creatures hear: So-and-so has succeeded with a happiness after which he will never be wretched. And if his scale is light, the angel calls out with a voice that all creatures hear: So-and-so has become wretched with a wretchedness after which he will never be happy.' In Sunan Abi Dawood from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, that she mentioned the Fire and wept. The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: 'What makes you weep?' She said: 'I mentioned the Fire and wept. Will you remember your families on the Day of Resurrection?' The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: 'As for three places, no one will remember anyone: At the Scale until he knows whether his scale is light or heavy; at the Book when it is said: (Here, read my record!) until he knows where his book will fall, in his right hand, his left, or from behind his back; and at the Sirat (Bridge) when it is placed across Hell.' In Al-Waseet from Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: 'Allah will offer three excuses to Adam. Allah will say: O Adam, were it not that I cursed the liars, hated the liar and the oath-breaker, and threatened (punishment), I would have had mercy on your children today, all of them, due to the severity of the punishment I have prepared for them. But the Word from Me has come into effect that if My messengers are denied and My command disobeyed, I will surely fill Hell with Jinn and people all together. And Allah Almighty says: O Adam, know that I will not enter anyone from your offspring into the Fire, nor punish anyone among them with the Fire, except him whom I know by My knowledge that if I returned him to the world, he would return to an evil worse than he was in, and would not return (to good) nor make amends. And He Almighty says: I have made a judgment between Me and your offspring'

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: Stand at the Scale and look at what is raised to you of their deeds. Whoever among them has his good outweigh his evil by the weight of an atom, to him belongs Paradise, so that you may know that I do not enter anyone of them into the Fire except an oppressor.' In the Sahih from Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: 'Do you know who is the bankrupt (Muflis)?' They said: 'The bankrupt among us is the one who has no dirham and no goods.' He said: 'Indeed, the bankrupt of my nation is the one who comes on the Day of Resurrection with prayer, Zakat, and fasting, but comes having insulted this one, slandered this one, eaten the wealth of this one, shed the blood of this one, and beaten this one. So this one is given from his good deeds, and this one from his good deeds. If his good deeds are exhausted before what is upon him is settled, their sins are taken and cast upon him, then he is cast into the Fire.' In the Sahih: 'The first thing to be judged is regarding blood.' In Ma'alim al-Tanzil, it is narrated from Abdullah bin Masud that he said: 'When it is the Day of Resurrection, Allah will gather the first and the last. Then a caller will call out: Whoever seeks a wrong done to him, let him come to his right and take it. So a person will rejoice to have a right against his father, his child, his wife, or his brother, so he takes from him, even if it is small. The confirmation of that is in the Book of Allah Almighty: (So when the Horn is blown, no relationship will there be among them that Day, nor will they ask about one another. So those whose scales are heavy - it is they who are the successful. And those whose scales are light - those are the ones who have lost their souls, [being] in Hell, abiding eternally.) The servant is brought, and a caller calls out over the heads of the first and the last: This is So-and-so son of So-and-so. Whoever has a right against him, let him come to his right. Then it is said: Give these their rights. He says: O Lord, from where? The world has gone. Allah Almighty says to the angels: Look into his righteous deeds and give them from them. If an atom's weight of a good deed remains, the angels say: O our Lord, an atom's weight of a good deed remains for him. Allah Almighty says: Multiply it for My servant and enter him into Paradise by the virtue of My mercy. The confirmation of that is in the Book of Allah Almighty: (Indeed, Allah does not do injustice, [even] as much as an atom's weight; while if there is a good deed, He multiplies it.)'

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: And if he was a wretched servant, the angels say: 'Our God, his good deeds have run out, and claimants remain.' So Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, says: 'Take from their bad deeds and add them to his bad deeds, then write him a cheque to the Fire.' Al-Tirmidhi mentioned from the Hadith of Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-Aas, may Allah be pleased with them both, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'Allah will single out a man from my nation (Ummah) at the head of all creatures on the Day of Resurrection. Ninety-nine scrolls will be spread out for him, each scroll as far as the eye can see. Then Allah will say: Do you deny anything of this? Have my recording scribes wronged you? He will say: No, O Lord. Allah will say: Do you have an excuse? He will say: No, O Lord. Allah will say: Yes, indeed you have a good deed with Us, and there will be no injustice upon you today. Then a card will be brought out containing: I bear witness that there is no god but Allah, and I bear witness that Muhammad is His Messenger. He will say: Bring your weighing. The man will say: O Lord, what is this card compared to these scrolls? It will be said: You will not be wronged. He said: So the scrolls are placed in one pan and the card in the other pan; the scrolls became light and the card became heavy. He said: Nothing is heavy next to the name of Allah.' Meaning: Whoever has the remembrance of Allah with him, nothing from sins can outweigh it; rather, the remembrance outweighs the sins. So reflect, may Allah have mercy on you, on your scale and beware of your loss. Know that whoever has no bad deed has Paradise, and whoever has no good deed has the Fire, and whoever mixed (good and bad), justice is by the scale. So fear Allah, O servants of Allah, and (fear) the injustices against servants by taking their wealth, attacking their honor, distressing their hearts, and ill conduct in associating with them. For what is between the servant and Allah specifically, forgiveness for it is faster. It is said that if the oppressed clings to the oppressor who is 'Awwab' (frequently returning to Allah), meaning he ceased the sin and did not return to it but could not seek release (from the oppressed), Allah says to the oppressed: 'Raise your head.' He raises his head and sees a magnificent palace looming. He says: 'What is this, O Lord?' He says: 'It is for sale, buy it from Me.' He says: 'I do not have its price.' He says: 'By absolving your brother of his injustice, the palace is yours.' He says: 'I have done so, O Lord.' It is narrated that when death approached Luqman the Wise, he wept. His son said to him: 'What makes you weep, O father?' He said: 'O my son, I do not weep for the world nor its delights, but for what is before me of the long distance, the deep desert, the steep obstacle, the little provision, and the heavy load. I do not know if that load will be lifted from me so I reach the destination, or if I will be burdened until I am driven to the Fire.'

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: For this I weep. Then he died, may Allah have mercy on him. Some of them recited: I see myself, when I speak to my soul of repentance... An obstacle appears to me preventing that. My life passed in distraction and heedlessness... And deeds of evil, none of them suitable. I was expelled while others are drawn near by righteousness... And before my attainment is a narrow path. How (can I reach) when the slips of the evildoer are many... Does a slave who fled from his masters draw near? To Allah I complain of a bad heart that passion... Has possessed, and attachments have uprooted it. I have a sadness increasing every moment... And the tears of my eyelids race to weep. If You forgive the sin I have committed... That is my hope, and thoughts (of You) agree. The sign of what He bestows of grace is if I... Abandon the worlds or say: You are divorced. There, every magnified secret appears... To my eye, and there the realities cover me.

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: Passing Over the Sirat (Bridge) and the Hawd (Basin). Allah Almighty said: (So by your Lord, We will surely gather them and the devils; then We will bring them to be present around Hell upon their knees. Then We will surely extract from every sect those of them who were worst against the Most Merciful in insolence. Then, surely it is We who are most knowing of those most worthy of burning therein. And there is none of you except he will come to it. This is upon your Lord an inevitability decreed. Then We will save those who feared Allah and leave the wrongdoers within it, on their knees.) [Maryam: 68-72]. There is disagreement regarding 'coming to it' (Wurud). It was said it is entering it while it is extinguished, so the believers cross it and it collapses with others. And it was said it is passing over the Sirat, for it is extended over it; Al-Nawawi, may Allah have mercy on him, authenticated this. In Sahih Muslim, from Abu Huraira or Hudhayfah, after mentioning the Hadith of Intercession where people resort to him, peace be upon him, for relief from the Standing and judgment between servants, he said: They come to Muhammad, so he stands and is given permission. Trust (Amanah) and Kinship (Rahim) are sent and stand on the sides of the Sirat, right and left. The first of you passes like lightning, then like the passing of birds and the fastest of men; their deeds carry them. Your Prophet, peace be upon him, stands on the Sirat saying: 'Lord, save! Lord, save!' until a man comes unable to proceed except crawling. He said: On the edges of the Sirat are hanging hooks commanded to take whom they are ordered. Some are scratched but saved, and some are piled into the Fire. By the One in Whose hand is the soul of Abu Huraira, the bottom of Hell is seventy autumns (years) deep. He said in 'Ikmal al-Ilm' interpreting the other Hadith: 'A huge rock is thrown from the edge of Hell and falls in it for seventy years until it reaches its resting place.' In Sahih Al-Bukhari, the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'When the believers are saved from the Fire, they are detained on a bridge between Paradise and the Fire, where they settle injustices that occurred between them

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: in the world. Until when they are cleansed and purified, they are permitted to enter Paradise. By the One in Whose hand is the soul of Muhammad, one of them is more guided to his dwelling in Paradise than he was to his dwelling in the world.' In Al-Risalah Al-Qushayriyyah, Mu'adh bin Jabal said: The believer's heart is not reassured nor does his fear subside until he leaves the bridge of Hell behind. Abu Maysarah, may Allah be pleased with him, whenever he went to his bed, would say: 'Would that my mother had not borne me,' then he would weep. It was said: 'What makes you weep?' He said: 'We were told that we would come to it (Hell), but we were not told that we would return from it.' Abdullah bin Rawaha wept and said: 'A verse was revealed in which my Lord informs me that I will come to the Fire, but He did not inform me that I will return from it; that is what made me weep.' Al-Hasan said: 'How can a believer not grieve when he has been told by Allah that he will come to Hell, but has not been told that he will return from it?' In Sahih Muslim from Anas, he said: While the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, was among us one day, he dozed off briefly, then raised his head smiling. It was said: 'What makes you laugh, O Messenger of Allah?' He said: 'A Surah was revealed to me just now, in which is read: In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful: (Indeed, We have granted you, [O Muhammad], al-Kawthar. So pray to your Lord and sacrifice [to Him alone]. Indeed, your enemy is the one cut off).' Then he said: 'Do you know what Al-Kawthar is?' We said: 'Allah and His Messenger know best.' He said: 'It is a river my Lord promised me, upon which is much good. It is a Hawd (Basin) to which my Ummah will come on the Day of Resurrection. Its vessels are as numerous as the stars. A servant from among them will be snatched away, and I will say: O Lord, indeed he is from my Ummah. He will say: You do not know what he introduced after you.' His saying 'yukhtalaj' (snatched away) is in the passive voice, meaning he is turned away from the Hawd; he is either an apostate or a sinner. In the book of Al-Tirmidhi from Samurah bin Jundub, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'Indeed,

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: every Prophet has a Hawd (Basin), and they boast about which of them has the most arrivals (waridah). And I hope that I will have the most arrivals.' In Sahih Al-Bukhari from Sahl bin Sa'd, he said: The Prophet, peace be upon him, said: 'I am your predecessor (Farat) at the Hawd. Whoever passes by me drinks, and whoever drinks will never thirst again. People will come to me whom I recognize and who recognize me, then a barrier will be placed between me and them.' Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri added, so he said: 'I will say: Indeed they are from me. It will be said: Indeed, you do not know what they introduced after you. So I will say: Away, away with those who changed after me.' 'He will never thirst' means never get thirsty. This implies that drinking from it is after the Account and salvation from the Fire. It implies that all those who arrive and pass by him drink, and only those who are driven away are prevented from arriving and passing. 'Suhqan' means away/far. This indicates that they are apostates from the religion, because he intercedes for sinners and cares for their affair, and does not say such things to them. In Sahih Al-Bukhari from Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, peace be upon him, he said: 'While I am standing at the Hawd, a group appears. Until when I recognize them, a man comes out between me and them and says: Come. I say: Where to? He says: To the Fire, by Allah. I say: What is their affair? He says: They turned back on their heels as apostates after you. Then another group appears. When I recognize them, a man comes out between me and them and says: Come. I say: Where to? He says: To the Fire, by Allah. I say: What is their affair? He says: They turned back on their heels as apostates. I do not see anyone saved among them except like the neglected cattle (Haml al-Na'am).' Al-Kirmani said in Al-Kawakib Al-Darari: 'Al-Haml' (with two Fathas) is what is left neglected, not tended to or pastured, until it is lost and perishes. Meaning: only a few of them are saved from the Fire. This indicates they are two types: disbelievers and sinners. In Sahih Muslim from Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, came to the graveyard and said: 'Peace be upon you, abode of believing people, and we, if Allah wills, will join you. I wish we had seen our brothers.' They said: 'Are we not your brothers, O Messenger of Allah?' He said: 'You are

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: my companions, and our brothers are those who have not come yet.' They said: 'How will you recognize those of your Ummah who have not come yet, O Messenger of Allah?' He said: 'Do you not see that if a man has horses with white blazes and white legs (Ghurr Muhajjalun) among jet-black horses, would he not recognize his horses?' They said: 'Yes, O Messenger of Allah.' He said: 'For they will come with white blazes and white limbs from Wudu (ablution), and I am their predecessor at the Hawd. Indeed, men will be driven away from my Hawd just as a stray camel is driven away. I will call out to them: Come here! Come here! It will be said: Indeed, they changed (the religion) after you. So I will say: Away, away!' In the book of Al-Tirmidhi from Thawban from the Prophet, peace be upon him: 'My Hawd is from Aden to Amman Balqa. Its water is whiter than milk and sweeter than honey. Its vessels are as numerous as the stars of the sky. Whoever drinks a sip from it will never thirst after it. The first people to arrive at it are the poor emigrants (Muhajirun), disheveled of head, dirty of clothes, who do not marry wealthy women, and for whom doors are not opened.' Umar bin Abd al-Aziz said: 'But I married wealthy women, and doors were opened for me. I married Fatima bint Abd al-Malik. No doubt, I will not wash my head until it becomes disheveled, and I will not wash my garment that touches my body until it becomes dirty.' In Sahih Al-Bukhari, Ibn Abi Mulaykah used to say: 'O Allah, we seek refuge in You from turning back on our heels or being seduced from our religion.' Know that the Hawd is in the hand of the Prophet, peace be upon him, at the gate of Paradise; the believers drink from it, and it is created today. So repent, O my brother, to your Lord and fear Him so He may relieve you of your worry, and ask Him to protect you from a Fitnah (trial) occurring in your religion, causing you to be driven away from the Hawd of your Prophet. It is said that Allah concealed three things in three: He concealed His pleasure in His obedience, so let none of you belittle anything of obedience, for perhaps a belittled act of obedience contains Allah's pleasure. He concealed His anger in His disobedience, so let none of you belittle anything of disobedience, for perhaps a belittled act of disobedience contains Allah's anger. And He concealed His Wali (saint/friend) among His creation, so let none of you belittle anyone of Allah's creation, for perhaps one who is not paid attention to is a Wali of Allah. He also concealed a fourth, which is the Response to Du'a (supplication), so let none of you belittle anything of Du'a, in any state and in any place. Stand at the door seeking... And shed tears pouring.

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: And seek means to Him and re... turn from sin repenting. You will meet from His good making... at that time wonders. Do not fear being turned back from... Allah's generosity disappointed. For He rewards for the littl... e and gives desires. A person's honor is in piety... so make truthfulness a companion. And be ashamed that your Lor... d sees you committing sin. Indeed, time has arrows for calamities striking accurately. And matters followed successively... stirring up disasters. So be pleased with Allah and hold fast... and ask Allah desiringly.

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: The Major Intercession (Al-Shafa'ah Al-Kubra). Allah Almighty said: (That Day, no intercession will benefit except [that of] one to whom the Most Merciful has given permission.) [Ta-Ha: 109]. Abu Bakr Al-Bazzar mentioned from the Prophet, peace be upon him, who said: 'People will be carried on the Day of Resurrection on the Sirat (Bridge), and they will fall off the sides of the Sirat like moths into the Fire. Then permission will be given to the angels, prophets, martyrs, and righteous people; they will intercede and bring out whoever is in the Fire.' It is narrated in the Sahih: 'The first to intercede are the Messengers, then the Prophets, then the Scholars.' In the book of Al-Tirmidhi, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'More than (the number of) Banu Tamim will enter Paradise through the intercession of a man from my Ummah.' It was said: 'O Messenger of Allah, other than you?' He said: 'Other than me.' In the Musnad of Al-Bazzar: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'Indeed, among my Ummah are those who will intercede for a large group (Fi'am) of people, and among them are those who will intercede for a tribe ('Usbah), and among them are those who will intercede for a clan (Qabilah), and among them are those who will intercede for a man and his household.' Al-Daraqutni narrated from Abu Umamah who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'I am the best of men for the evil ones of my Ummah.' They said: 'How about for the good ones?' He said: 'As for the good ones, they will enter Paradise by their deeds. As for the evil ones of my Ummah, they will enter Paradise by my intercession.' It is narrated from Awf bin Malik who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'A comer came to me from Allah and gave me a choice between half of my Ummah entering Paradise and intercession. I chose intercession, and it is for whoever dies not associating anything with Allah.' In Al-Wasit by Al-Wahidi from Jabir, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, say: 'A man will say in Paradise: What happened to my friend? While his friend is in Hell. So Allah, Mighty and Majestic, will say: Bring out his friend to Paradise. Then those remaining therein will say: So we have no intercessors nor a close friend.'

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: In Sahih Muslim from Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri, he said: Some people said: 'O Messenger of Allah, will we see our Lord on the Day of Resurrection?' The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'Yes.' He said: 'Do you have trouble seeing the sun at noon on a clear day with no clouds? And do you have trouble seeing the moon on the night of the full moon on a clear night with no clouds?' They said: 'No, O Messenger of Allah.' He said: 'You will not have trouble seeing Allah, Blessed and Exalted, on the Day of Resurrection except as you have trouble seeing one of them. When it is the Day of Resurrection, a caller will announce: Let every nation follow what it used to worship. So no one who used to worship other than Allah Almighty, such as idols and stones (Ansab), will remain but will fall into the Fire. Until only those who used to worship Allah, righteous or wicked, and the remnants of the People of the Book remain. Then the Jews will be called and it will be said to them: What did you used to worship? They will say: We used to worship Uzair, son of Allah. It will be said: You have lied; Allah has not taken a wife or a son. So what do you want? They will say: We are thirsty, our Lord, so give us drink. It will be signaled to them: Will you not go down to drink? So they will be gathered to the Fire as if it were a mirage, smashing against itself, and they will fall into the Fire. Then the Christians will be called and it will be said to them: What did you used to worship? They will say: We used to worship the Messiah, son of Allah. It will be said to them: You have lied; Allah has not taken a wife or a son. It will be said to them: What do you want? They will say: We are thirsty, O our Lord, so give us drink. He said: It will be signaled to them: Will you not go down to drink? So they will be gathered to Hell as if it were a mirage, smashing against itself, and they will fall into the Fire. Until only those who used to worship Allah Almighty, righteous or wicked, remain. The Lord of the Worlds, Glory be to Him, will come to them in a form closer [to their recognition] than the one they saw Him in. He will say: What are you waiting for? Every nation has followed what it used to worship. They will say: O our Lord, we separated from people in the world when we were most in need of them and did not accompany them. He will say: I am your Lord. They will say: We seek refuge in Allah from you; we do not associate anything with Allah - twice or thrice - until some of them are about to turn away. He will say: Is there a sign between you and Him by which you recognize Him? They will say: Yes. Then the Shin will be uncovered. No one who used to prostrate to Allah of his own accord will remain but Allah will permit him to prostrate. And no one who used to prostrate out of fear or showing off will remain but Allah will make his back a single slab; whenever he wants to prostrate, he will fall on his back. Then they will raise their heads, and He has transformed into His form which they saw Him in the first time. He will say: I am your Lord. They will say: You are our Lord. The Fire has taken up to half their shins and up to their knees. Then the Bridge (Jisr) will be struck over Hell and Intercession will be permitted. They will say: O Allah, save, save. It was said: O Messenger of Allah, what is the Bridge? He said: Slippery

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: and sliding, upon it are hooks, claws, and thorns like the thorns of Sa'dan found in Najd. The believers will pass like the blink of an eye, like lightning, like wind, like birds, and like excellent horses and camels. So one is saved unharmed, one is scratched but released, and one is piled into the Fire of Hell. Until when the believers are saved from the Fire - by the One in Whose hand is my soul, none of you is more persistent in pleading to Allah for his right than the believers will be to Allah on the Day of Resurrection for their brothers who are in the Fire. They will say: 'Our Lord, they used to fast with us, pray, and perform Hajj.' It will be said to them: 'Bring out those you recognize.' So their forms will be forbidden to the Fire, and they will bring out many people whom the Fire had taken up to half their shins and up to their knees. Then they will say: 'Our Lord, no one remains therein of those You ordered us [to save].' He will say: 'Return, and whoever you find in his heart the weight of a Dinar of good, bring him out.' So they will bring out many people. Then they will say: 'Our Lord, we have not left therein anyone of those You ordered us [to save].' Then He will say: 'Return, and whoever you find in his heart the weight of half a Dinar of good, bring him out.' So they will bring out many people. Then they will say: 'Our Lord, we have not left any good therein.' Then Allah will say: 'The angels have interceded, the Prophets have interceded, and the believers have interceded, and none remains but the Most Merciful of the merciful.' He will grab a handful from the Fire and bring out people who never did any good, who had turned into charcoal. He will throw them into a river at the mouths of Paradise called the River of Life. They will emerge as a seed emerges in the silt of a flood. Do you not see it facing the stone or the tree? What faces the sun is yellowish and greenish, and what faces the shade is white? They said: 'O Messenger of Allah, it is as if you were herding in the desert.' He said: 'They will emerge like pearls, with seals on their necks. The people of Paradise will recognize them: These are the freed ones of Allah whom Allah admitted to Paradise without any deed they did or good they offered. It will be said to them: You have what you saw and the like of it with it.'

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: Know that the intercessions are five: First: Relief from the terror of the Standing and hastening the Account; this is specific to Muhammad, peace be upon him. Second: Admitting a people into Paradise without account; this is also narrated for him, peace be upon him. Third: A people who deserved the Fire, so a Prophet intercedes for them, and whoever Allah wills intercedes for them. Fourth: Increasing degrees in Paradise for its people. Fifth: Regarding those who entered the Fire from the sinners; a Prophet and others from the Prophets, Angels, and their believing brothers intercede for them. Then Allah brings out everyone who said 'There is no god but Allah' without the intercession of an intercessor, until none remain in it except the disbelievers, as in the Hadith from Anas: 'Then I return the fourth time and praise Him with those praises, then I fall down prostrate to Him. It is said: O Muhammad, raise your head, and speak, you will be heard; ask, you will be given; and intercede, your intercession will be accepted. So I say: O Lord, permit me regarding whoever said 'There is no god but Allah'. He says: That is not for you, but by My Might, My Pride, My Greatness, and My Grandeur, I will surely bring out whoever said 'There is no god but Allah'.' Meaning: I will bestow favor by bringing them out without the intercession of an intercessor. These are the ones who have mere faith, and for whom permission for intercession was not granted. The narrations only indicate that permission was granted for those who have something extra to faith, such as a righteous deed, hidden remembrance, or an act of the heart like compassion for a poor person, fear of Allah, or sincere intention for a missed deed, and He made for the intercessors from Angels and Prophets a sign upon it. And Allah alone knows

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: what the hearts conceal. Mercy is for those who have nothing but faith. His saying 'atom's weight of faith and good', the correct meaning is something extra to mere faith, because mere faith, which is affirmation, is indivisible. So adhere, my brother, to faith: believe in your heart in the religion of Islam and pronounce with that the two testimonies. For if you limit yourself to one of them, you will abide eternally in the Fire of Hell whose fuel is men and stones, and no intercessor's intercession will benefit you. Then you must guard against sins, for sins are the messenger of disbelief. It is narrated that a student of Al-Fudayl bin Iyad was dying. Al-Fudayl entered upon him, sat by his head, and recited Surah Ya-Sin. He said: 'O teacher, do not recite this Surah.' So he fell silent. Then he instructed him, saying: 'Say there is no god but Allah.' He said: 'I will not say it, for I am innocent of it,' and he died upon that. Al-Fudayl entered his house and wept for forty days, not leaving the house. Then he saw him in a dream being dragged to Hell. He said: 'By what thing did Allah remove gnosis (Ma'rifa) from you, and you were the most knowledgeable of my students?' He said: 'By three things: First: Calumny (Namimah); I used to tell my companions the opposite of what I told you. Second: Envy; I envied my companions. Third: I had an illness, so I went to a doctor and asked him about it. He said: Drink a cup of wine every year, for if you do not, the illness will remain with you. So I used to drink it.' We seek refuge in Allah from the wrath we cannot bear. Some said: If the world leaves a man his religion... Then what he missed of it is not harmful. O Allah, have mercy on us and do not punish us, grant us success and do not forsake us, and do not strip faith from us at our ends, for we have no refuge but You, and no reliance but on You, O Most Merciful of the merciful.

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: The Punishment of Disbelievers in Hell. Allah Almighty said: (But those who disbelieved will have cut out for them garments of fire. Poured upon their heads will be scalding water. By which is melted that within their bellies and [their] skins. And for [striking] them are maces of iron. Every time they want to get out of it from anguish, they will be returned to it, and [it will be said], 'Taste the punishment of the Burning Fire!'). [Al-Hajj: 19-22]. (The Fire will sear their faces, and they therein will have taut smiles). [Al-Mu'minun: 104]. (When the shackles are around their necks and the chains; they will be dragged. In boiling water; then in the Fire they will be filled [with flame]). [Ghafir: 71-72]. (And for those who disbelieve will be the fire of Hell. [Death] is not decreed for them so they may die, nor will its torment be lightened for them. Thus do We recompense every ungrateful one. And they will cry out therein, 'Our Lord, remove us; we will do righteousness - other than what we were doing!' But did We not grant you life enough for whoever would remember therein to remember, and the warner came to you? So taste [the punishment], for there is not for the wrongdoers any helper). [Fatir: 36-37]. (Indeed, the tree of Zaqqum. Is food for the sinful. Like murky oil, it boils within bellies. Like the boiling of scalding water. [It will be commanded], 'Seize him and drag him into the midst of the Hellfire. Then pour over his head from the torment of scalding water. Taste! Indeed, you are the honored, the noble!'). [Ad-Dukhan: 43-49]. (And the companions of the left - what are the companions of the left? In scorching fire and scalding water. And a shade of black smoke. Neither cool nor noble. Indeed, they were before that indulging in affluence. And they used to persist in the great violation. And they used to say, 'When we die and become dust and bones, are we indeed to be resurrected? And our forefathers [as well]?' Say, 'Indeed, the former and the later peoples. Are to be gathered

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: for the appointment of a known Day.' Then indeed you, O those astray [who are] deniers, Will be eating from trees of Zaqqum. And filling with it your bellies. And drinking on top of it from scalding water. And will drink as the drinking of thirsty camels. That is their accommodation on the Day of Recompense. We have created you, so why do you not believe?) [Al-Waqi'a: 41-57]. ('Seize him and shackle him. Then into Hellfire drive him. Then into a chain whose length is seventy cubits insert him. Indeed, he did not used to believe in Allah, the Most Great. Nor did he encourage the feeding of the poor. So there is not for him here this Day any devoted friend. Nor any food except from the discharge of wounds. Which none eat except the sinners.') [Al-Haqqah: 30-37]. (Has there reached you the report of the Overwhelming [event]? [Some] faces, that Day, will be humbled. Working [hard] and exhausted. They will [enter to] burn in an intensely hot Fire. They will be given drink from a boiling spring. For them there will be no food except from a poisonous, thorny plant. Which neither nourishes nor avails against hunger.) [Al-Ghashiyah: 1-7]. In the book of Al-Tirmidhi from Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Prophet, peace be upon him, said: 'When Allah created Paradise, He said to Gabriel: Go and look at it. So he went and looked at it and at what Allah had prepared for its people in it. Then he came back and said: O Lord, by Your Might, no one hears of it but enters it. Then He surrounded it with hardships. Then He said: O Gabriel, go and look at it. So he went and looked at it, then came back and said: O Lord, by Your Might, I fear that no one will enter it. He said: When Allah created the Fire, He said: O Gabriel, go and look at it. So he went and looked at it, then said: O Lord, by Your Might, no one hears of it and enters it. So He surrounded it with desires. Then He said: O Gabriel, go and look at it. So he went and looked at it, then said: O Lord, by Your Might, I fear that no one will remain but enter it.' In Sahih Muslim, the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'This fire of yours which the son of Adam kindles is one part of seventy parts of the fire of Hell.' They said: 'By Allah, it would have been sufficient, O Messenger of

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: Allah.' He said: 'It exceeds it by sixty-nine parts, each like its heat.' Sufyan bin Uyaynah mentioned from Abu Huraira. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'This fire of yours is one part of seventy parts of the fire of Hell, and were it not that it was struck with water twice, no one would have benefited from it.' In the book of Al-Tirmidhi from Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'The Fire was kindled for a thousand years until it turned red, then kindled for a thousand years until it turned white, then kindled for a thousand years until it turned black, so it is black and dark.' In Sahih Muslim from Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: We were with the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, when he heard a thud. The Prophet, peace be upon him, said: 'Do you know what this is?' He said: We said Allah and His Messenger know best. He said: 'This is a stone thrown into the Fire seventy autumns ago, and it has been falling in the Fire until now it reached its bottom, so you heard its thud.' In the book of Al-Tirmidhi from Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-Aas, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'If a pebble like this - pointing to a skull - were sent from the sky to the earth, a distance of five hundred years, it would reach the earth before night. And if it were sent from the head of the Chain, it would travel forty autumns, night and day, before reaching its base or bottom.' In Sahih Al-Bukhari from Anas from the Prophet, peace be upon him, he said: 'Allah says to the person of the Fire with the least punishment on the Day of Resurrection: If you had everything on earth, would you ransom yourself with it? He says: Yes. He says: I wanted from you easier than this while you were in the loins of Adam: that you not associate anything with Me, but you refused except to associate.' In Sahih Muslim from Al-Nu'man bin Bashir, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said:

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: 'The person of the Fire with the least punishment is one who has two sandals and straps of fire from which his brain boils as a cauldron boils. He does not see anyone with more severe punishment than him, yet he is the one with the least punishment.' In it from Samurah bin Jundub that he heard the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, say: 'Among them are those whom the Fire takes up to his ankles, and among them those it takes up to his waist, and among them those it takes up to his neck.' In the Musnad of Al-Bazzar from Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'If there were one hundred thousand or more in the mosque and a man from the people of the Fire breathed, he would burn them.' In the book of Al-Tirmidhi from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'If a drop of Zaqqum were dropped into the world, it would spoil the livelihoods of the people of the world, so how about him whose food it is?' From Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri from the Prophet, peace be upon him, he said: 'The pavilion of the Fire has four walls, and the thickness of each wall is a distance of forty years.' He, peace be upon him, said: 'If a bucket of Ghassaq (pus) were spilled in the world, the people of the world would stink.' Scholars said: It is the sweat and pus of the people of the Fire. It is said: Their tears, which they are made to drink with boiling water. And he, peace be upon him, said: 'Wayl is a valley in Hell into which the disbeliever falls for forty autumns before reaching its bottom. And Al-Sa'ud is a mountain of fire he ascends for seventy autumns and falls likewise forever.' And he, peace be upon him, said: 'If a mace of iron were placed on earth and the two heavy creations (Jinn and Men) gathered, they would not move it from the ground. And he said: If a mountain were struck with a mace of iron, it would crumble and become dust.' In the book of Al-Tirmidhi from Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'A neck will emerge from the Fire on the Day of Resurrection having two eyes that see, two ears that hear, and a tongue that speaks. It says: I have been entrusted with three: every obstinate tyrant, everyone who called on another god with Allah, and the picture-makers.' In the book of Al-Tirmidhi from Abu Umamah, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, peace be upon him, regarding His saying: (

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: And he will be given a drink of purulent water. Which he will gulp but will hardly swallow). [Ibrahim: 16-17]. He said: 'It is brought near his mouth, and when it is close, it roasts his face and the scalp of his head falls off. If he drinks it, it cuts his intestines until it exits from his anus.' Allah Almighty says: (And are given to drink scalding water that will sever their intestines). [Muhammad: 15]. And He, Mighty and Exalted, says: (And if they call for relief, they will be relieved with water like murky oil, which scalds the faces). [Al-Kahf: 29]. In it from Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, peace be upon him, he said: 'Scalding water will be poured over their heads, and the scalding water will penetrate until it reaches his belly, shearing off what is in his belly until it passes out from his feet. That is the melting (Al-Sahr). Then he is restored as he was.' In it from Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, peace be upon him, he said: 'And they therein will have taut smiles (Kalihun): He said the Fire burns him so his upper lip contracts until it reaches the middle of his head, and his lower lip hangs down until it strikes his navel.' In the book of Al-Tirmidhi, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'The thickness of the disbeliever's skin is forty-two cubits, his molar is like Uhud, and his seat in Hell is as the distance between Mecca and Medina.' In Sahih Muslim, he said: 'The molar of the disbeliever or the canine of the disbeliever is like Uhud, and the thickness of his skin is a three-day journey.' He said: 'The distance between the shoulders of the disbeliever in the Fire is a three-day journey for a fast rider.' It is narrated from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, that he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'The disbeliever will drag his tongue a Farsakh or two, and people will tread on it.' In the book of Al-Tirmidhi and others from Anas, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'O people, weep! If you cannot weep, then pretend to weep. For the people of the Fire weep in the Fire until their tears flow

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: on their faces like streams. Until the tears stop and blood flows, and the eyes become ulcerated. If ships were sailed in them (the tears/blood), they would sail.' It is related about Shaqiq Al-Balkhi that he was once rebuking his soul and advising it, saying: 'O Shaqiq, do not disobey Allah except according to what you can bear of His punishment. Work for your Hereafter according to your need for it. Seek provision according to your station in the world. And work for a home that has no end, for you will see when the dust clears whether under you is a horse or a donkey.' It is narrated that Al-Rabi' bin Khuthaym was going to Ibn Mas'ud and passed by a blacksmith's shop. He saw the iron heated in the bellows and fainted. He did not recover until the next day. When he recovered, he was asked about that. He said: 'I remembered the state of the people of the Fire in the Fire.' My brothers, correct your faith: which is the belief of the heart, and it is not considered except with the utterance of the two testimonies, so that you may be saved from eternity in the Fire of Hell. Be keen with every keenness to perform the perfection of the characteristics of Islam so that you may be saved from entering it at all. O worker for the Fire, your body is soft... So test it for practice in the heat of noon. And train it in the sting of wasps, daring... Against the bite of great snakes there. If you cannot endure, woe to you, what... Called you to anger the Lord of creation? You fight with abominations in the evening... And wake up in the garments of asceticism and chastity. So you are bolder against Him than creation... Due to what is in you of ignorance and malicious intent. You say with disobedience: My Lord is Forgiving... You spoke truth, but Forgiving by will. And your Lord is Provider just as He is Forgiving... So why did you not believe in both equally? For you hope for pardon without repentance... But do not hope for provision except with a trick. Although He guaranteed provision Himself... For everyone, but did not guarantee Paradise for everyone. My God, save us from our great sins... And do not disgrace us, and look upon us with mercy.

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: And take our forelocks to You and grant us... Certainty that protects us from every doubt and suspicion. My God, guide us among those You guided and take us... To the Truth on a clear path in the middle of the way. And be our preoccupation from every preoccupation, and our concern... And our desire from every concern and desire. And bless with a blessing without end upon the one... Whom You made as musk, the Seal of Prophecy.

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: Eternity in the Fire for Disbelievers. Allah Almighty said: (But they who disbelieved and denied Our signs - those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally). [Al-Baqarah: 39]. In the book of Al-Tirmidhi from Abu Al-Darda', may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'Hunger will be cast upon the people of the Fire, equaling the torment they are in. They will seek relief in food, so they will be relieved with food of Dari' (bitter thorny plant) which neither nourishes nor avails against hunger. They will seek relief in food, so they will be relieved with food that chokes. They will remember that they used to pass choking food in the world with drink, so they will seek relief in drink. Scalding water will be raised to them with iron hooks. When it approaches their faces, it roasts their faces. When it enters their bellies, it severs what is in their bellies. They will say: Call the keepers of Hell. They will say: Did there not come to you your messengers with clear proofs? They will say: Yes. They will say: Then pray; and the prayer of the disbelievers is only in error. He said: They will say: Call Malik. They will say: O Malik, let your Lord put an end to us. He said: He will answer them: Indeed, you will remain. Al-A'mash said: It is established that between their call and Malik's answer to them is a thousand years. He said: They will say: Call your Lord, for no one is better than your Lord. They will say: Our Lord, our wretchedness overcame us, and we were a people astray. Our Lord, remove us from it, and if we return, then indeed we are wrongdoers. He said: He will answer them: (Remain despised therein and do not speak to Me). He said: At that, they will despair of all good, and at that they will take to moaning, regret, and woe.' It is narrated that the flame of the Fire lifts the people of the Fire until they fly like sparks fly. When it lifts them, they overlook Paradise, and between them is a barrier. The people of Paradise call to the people of the Fire that we have...

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: found what our Lord promised us to be true. Have you found what your Lord promised you to be true? They said: Yes. Then an announcer announced between them that the curse of Allah is on the wrongdoers. And the companions of the Fire called to the companions of Paradise: Pour upon us some water or from whatever Allah has provided you. They said: Indeed, Allah has forbidden them both to the disbelievers. So the angels of punishment return them with iron maces to the bottom of Hell. Some commentators said: This is the meaning of Allah Almighty's saying: (Every time they want to get out of it, they will be returned to it, and it will be said to them, 'Taste the punishment of the Fire which you used to deny'). [As-Sajdah: 20]. In Al-Kashshaf and Anwar al-Tanzil from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both: They have six calls when they enter the Fire. They say for a thousand years: (Our Lord, we have seen and heard, so return us [to the world]; we will work righteousness). They are answered: (But the word from Me has come into effect). They say for a thousand years: (They will say, 'Our Lord, You made us lifeless twice and gave us life twice, and we have admitted our sins. So is there to an exit any way?'). They are answered: (That is because, when Allah was called upon alone, you disbelieved). They say for a thousand years: (O Malik, let your Lord put an end to us). They are answered: (Indeed, you will remain). They say for a thousand years: (Our Lord, delay us for a short term; we will answer Your call). They are answered: (Did you not swear before that for you there would be no cessation?).

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: They say for a thousand years: (Our Lord, remove us; we will do righteousness). They are answered: (Did We not grant you life enough for whoever would remember therein to remember, and the warner came to you?). They say for a thousand years: (My Lord, return me. That I might do righteousness in that which I left behind. No! It is only a word he is saying). They are answered: (Remain despised therein and do not speak to Me). Then they will have nothing therein except moaning, sighing, and howling. In Sahih Muslim from Abdullah bin Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, that the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'When the people of Paradise arrive in Paradise and the people of the Fire in the Fire, Death will be brought until it is placed between Paradise and the Fire. Then it will be slaughtered. Then a caller will call out: O people of Paradise, no death! O people of the Fire, no death! So the people of Paradise will increase in joy upon their joy, and the people of the Fire will increase in sorrow upon their sorrow.' In the book of Al-Tirmidhi: If anyone were to die of joy, the people of Paradise would die; and if anyone were to die of sorrow, the people of the Fire would die. So fear Allah, O my brother, and do not belittle a sin, nor throw something like this behind your back, thinking that it only applies to disbelievers. For Al-Bukhari narrated in his Sahih that the Prophet, peace be upon him, said: 'O Bilal, stand up and announce: None shall enter Paradise except a believer.' And he, peace be upon him, said: 'Indeed, a servant may do the deeds of the people of the Fire while he is of the people of Paradise, and do the deeds of the people of Paradise while he is of the people of the Fire. Indeed, deeds are by their endings.'

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: Al-Ghazali, may Allah have mercy on him, said: Our Sheikh used to say: If (you consider) the state of the disbelievers and their eternity in the Fire, do not feel safe for yourself, for the matter is dangerous. You do not know what the outcome will be, nor what has been predestined for you in the judgment of the Unseen. Do not be deceived by the purity of times, for beneath them are obscure calamities. From Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, regarding the Almighty's saying: (So let those beware who dissent from the Prophet's order, lest fitnah strike them or a painful punishment). It is death other than martyrdom. [Text missing/garbled here in source, seemingly jumping to another narration] ... half a Dinar of good, bring him out. So they will bring out many people. Then they will say: Our Lord, we have not left therein anyone of those You ordered us [to save]. Then He will say: Return, and whoever you find in his heart an atom's weight... Abu Hafs Al-Haddad said: It is the messenger of disbelief, just as fever is the messenger of death. Hatim Al-Asamm said: Do not be deceived by a righteous place, for no place is more righteous than Paradise, yet Adam encountered in it what he encountered. Do not be deceived by abundance of worship, for Iblis after long worship encountered what he encountered. Do not be deceived by abundance of knowledge, for Balaam (Bal'am) knew the Greatest Name of Allah, so look at what he encountered. Do not be deceived by seeing the righteous, for no person is greater than Al-Mustafa (Muhammad), yet his relatives and enemies did not benefit from meeting him. From Abu Bakr Al-Warraq, may Allah have mercy on him, he said: Most often faith is stripped from the servant at death. We looked into sins and found none more stripping of faith than injustice against servants. Be content, may I be your ransom, with little... And adhere to the company of obscurity. Control your desire, striving... And step away from 'it was said' and 'he said'.

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: For you will be asked on the Day... The King gathers you, about the wick (futil - smallest thing). And a person is occupied by that... Away from the companion and friend. You must be requited for what you did... Of the small and the great. Step away as much as you can from your sins, morning and evening. If you desire the Gardens, and the shading shade of your Master. It says in 'Ikmal al-Mu'allim': Know that consensus has occurred that disbelievers do not benefit from their deeds, nor are they rewarded for them by lightening of punishment or by bliss. But by adding major sins, evil deeds, and harming believers to disbelief, they increase in punishment. As Allah Almighty said: (What put you into Saqar? They said, 'We were not of those who prayed. Nor did we used to feed the poor. And we used to enter into vain discourse with those who engaged in it. And we used to deny the Day of Recompense. Until there came to us the certainty.' So there will not benefit them the intercession of intercessors). [Al-Muddaththir: 42-48]. So the punishment of Abu Talib is not like the punishment of Abu Jahl. It is mentioned from Al-Hasan that the last one to exit the Fire is called Hannad; he was tortured for a thousand years calling out: 'O Hannan, O Mannan.' Al-Hasan wept and said: 'Would that I were Hannad.' They were amazed at him. He said: 'Woe to you, will he not exit one day?' No doubt, may Allah have mercy on him, he was knowledgeable about the rulings of the Hereafter. Yahya bin Mu'adh said: You do not know which of the two calamities is greater: missing the Gardens, or...

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: ...entering the Fires. As for Paradise, there is no patience away from it, and as for the Fire, there is no patience upon it. In any case, missing out on bliss is easier than enduring Hellfire. Then the Great Calamity and the Grand Disaster is in Eternity, for what heart can bear it and what soul can endure it?

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: Paradise and the Bliss for its People. Allah Almighty said: (And give good tidings to those who believe and do righteous deeds that they will have gardens beneath which rivers flow. Whenever they are provided with a provision of fruit therefrom, they will say, 'This is what we were provided with before.' And it is brought to them in resemblance. And they will have therein purified spouses, and they will abide therein eternally). [Al-Baqarah: 25]. And the Foremost, meaning to migration or good. (And the Foremost are the Foremost. Those are the ones brought near [to Allah]. In the Gardens of Pleasure. A [large] company of the former peoples. And a few of the later peoples. On thrones woven [with gold and precious stones]. Reclining on them, facing each other. There will circulate among them young boys made eternal. With vessels, pitchers, and a cup [of wine] from a flowing spring. No headache will they have therefrom, nor will they be intoxicated. And fruit of what they select. And the meat of fowl, from whatever they desire. And [for them are] fair women with large, [beautiful] eyes. The likes of pearls well-protected. As reward for what they used to do. They will not hear therein ill speech or commission of sin. Only a saying: 'Peace, Peace'). [Al-Waqi'a: 10-26].

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: (And the companions of the right - what are the companions of the right? Among lote trees with thorns removed.) Meaning it has no thorns or its branches are bent from the abundance of fruit. (And banana trees layered [with fruit].) Talh means bananas. Mandud means piled up with fruit from bottom to top. (And shade extended.) Meaning spread out or permanent. In the Hadith: 'In Paradise is a tree under whose shade a rider travels for a hundred years without crossing it.' (And water poured out.) Meaning flowing on the surface of the ground without a trench. (And fruit, abundant. Neither limited [to season] nor forbidden.) From anyone. (And upon beds raised high.) As between heaven and earth. ([Some] faces, that Day, will be radiant.) Possessing joy. (With their effort) in the world (satisfied.) In the Hereafter when they see its reward. (In an elevated garden.) In place or rank. (Wherein they will hear no unsuitable speech.) Laghw (vain talk). (Within it is a flowing spring. Within it are couches raised high.) Thick and high; if its owner wants to sit on it, it lowers for him then rises. (And cups put in place.) Before them. (And cushions) Pillows (set in rows.) Beside one another. (And carpets) Luxurious rugs (spread around.) Spread out.

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: In Sahih Muslim from Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'Allah Almighty said: I have prepared for My righteous servants what no eye has seen, no ear has heard, and has not occurred to the heart of a human. Recite if you wish: (And no soul knows what has been hidden for them of comfort for eyes).' [As-Sajdah: 17]. Linguists say 'comfort for eyes' (Qurrat A'yun) expresses joy and seeing what a person loves and agrees with. In Sahih Al-Bukhari from Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, peace be upon him: 'Indeed, in Paradise is a tree under whose shade a rider travels for a hundred years. Recite if you wish: (And shade extended). And the space of a bow of one of you in Paradise is better than what the sun rises upon or sets.' In the book of Al-Tirmidhi: 'There is no tree in Paradise except that its trunk is of gold.' In the book of Al-Tirmidhi from Abu Huraira, he said: I said, 'O Messenger of Allah, from what is creation created?' He said: 'From water.' We said, 'Paradise, what is its building?' He said: 'A brick of gold and a brick of silver, its mortar is musk of strong fragrance, its pebbles are pearls and rubies, and its soil is saffron. Whoever enters it is blessed and does not despair, lives eternally and does not die. Their youth does not fade, and their clothes do not wear out.' In Sahih Muslim: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'The first group to enter Paradise will be in the form of the moon on the night of the full moon. The one following them will be like the light of a glittering star in the sky.

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: For every man among them are two wives; the marrow of their shanks can be seen from behind the flesh. And there is no bachelor in Paradise.' Also in it: '...They do not urinate, defecate, blow their noses, or spit. Their combs are gold, their sweat is musk, their incense burners are aloeswood, and their wives are houris with large beautiful eyes. Their character is upon the character of one man, in the form of their father Adam, sixty cubits in the sky.' Also in it: '...There is no disagreement among them nor hatred; their hearts are as one heart. They glorify Allah morning and evening.' In it he said: 'The people of Paradise eat and drink therein, but they do not spit, urinate, defecate, or blow their noses.' They said: 'Then what about the food?' He said: 'Belching and sweating like the sweat of musk. They are inspired to glorify and praise (Allah) as you are inspired to breathe.' In the Two Sahihs he said: 'The people of Paradise will look at the people of the chambers above them just as you look at a glittering star far away on the horizon from the East and West, due to the superiority between them.' They said: 'O Messenger of Allah, are those the stations of Prophets that no one else reaches?' He said: 'Nay, by the One in Whose hand is my soul, men who believed in Allah and believed the Messengers.' In the Musnad of Al-Bazzar from Abdullah bin Mas'ud, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'You will look at a bird in Paradise and desire it, so it will fall down roasted before you.' In the book of Al-Tirmidhi from Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'In Paradise there are chambers whose outside is seen from their inside, and their inside from their outside.' A Bedouin stood up to him and said: 'For whom are they, O Messenger of Allah?' He said: 'For those who speak good words, feed food, persist in fasting, and pray at night while people are asleep.'

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: In the book of Al-Tirmidhi from Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas from the Prophet, peace be upon him, he said: 'If what a fingernail carries of what is in Paradise appeared, it would adorn what is between the corners of the heavens and the earth. And if a man from the people of Paradise looked out and his bracelets appeared, his light would obliterate the light of the sun just as the sun obliterates the light of the stars.' In the book of Al-Tirmidhi from Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'In Paradise there is a market wherein there is no buying or selling, only images of men and women. So if a man desires an image, he enters it.' In the book of Al-Tirmidhi from Sulayman bin Buraydah from his father that a man said: 'O Messenger of Allah, are there horses in Paradise?' He said: 'If Allah admits you into Paradise, you will not wish to be carried therein on a horse of red ruby that flies with you in Paradise wherever you wish, except you will be carried.' A man asked him: 'O Messenger of Allah, are there camels in Paradise?' He said: 'If Allah admits you into Paradise, you will have therein whatever your soul desires and your eye delights in.' In the book of Al-Tirmidhi, he, peace be upon him, said: 'Whoever dies from the people of Paradise, young or old, they are returned to the age of thirty-three in Paradise; they never increase upon that ever. Likewise the people of the Fire.' And he said: 'Upon them are crowns; the lowest pearl of it illuminates what is between the East and West.' In the book of Al-Tirmidhi, he said: 'In Paradise are one hundred degrees; between every two degrees is like what is between the heaven and the earth. Al-Firdaws is the highest degree; from it the four rivers of Paradise gush forth, and above it is the Throne. So if you ask Allah, ask Him for Al-Firdaws.' It is narrated that the companions of Al-Thawri spoke to him about what they saw of his fear and effort and his pathetic state. They said: 'O teacher, if you decreased this effort, you would also attain your desire, God willing.' Sufyan said: 'How can I not strive when it has reached me that the people of Paradise will be in their dwellings when a light appears to them illuminating the eight Gardens. So they will think that light is from

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: the Lord, Glory be to Him, and they will fall down prostrate. Then it will be called out to them: Raise your heads, it is not what you think; it is only the light of a bondwoman who smiled in the face of her master.' Then he recited: 'What harm is there for one whose dwelling is Firdaws... Whatever misery and poverty he endured? You see him walking sad, fearful, and timid... To the mosques walking in tatters. O soul, you have no patience for the Fire... The time has come for you to approach after turning away.' It was said to Wahb bin Munabbih: 'Is not "There is no god but Allah" the key to Paradise?' He said: 'Yes, but there is no key except that it has teeth. If you bring a key with teeth, it will open for you, otherwise it will not open for you.' Al-Bukhari mentioned it in his Sahih. It is narrated that Allah Almighty revealed to Moses: (How little shame has he who covets My Paradise without deeds. How can I bestow My mercy on one who is stingy with My obedience...). From Shahr bin Hawshab: Asking for Paradise without deeds is a sin among sins. Waiting for intercession without a cause is a type of delusion. And hoping for mercy from One who is not obeyed is folly and disappointment. From Rabi'ah Al-Adawiyyah that she used to recite: 'You hope for salvation but do not tread its paths... Indeed, the ship does not sail on dry land.' Sheikh Al-Yafi'i, may Allah have mercy on him, said: 'O wonder, we know of Fire and Paradise... Yet not for this do we yearn nor of that beware. If there is no fear, longing, or shame... Then what good remains in us to be mentioned? We are not patient with heat or affliction... So how can we endure the Fires, O people? Missing the Gardens of Eternity is the greatest regret... Over that let the regretful regret.'
