text: 'Fie upon us, fie, dogs of dunghills... To its stench we go early and do not reflect. We sell the significant for the worthless in blindness... And we have no intellect or enlightened heart. Blessed is he who is given contentment and piety... And spends his times in obedience to Allah.' O Allah, make us among the pious inheritors of Paradise, and do not deprive us of Your aid and mercy, O Possessor of Great Favor.

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: Description of the Houris (Hoor al-Ayn). Allah Almighty said: (And [for them are] fair women with large, [beautiful] eyes. The likes of pearls well-protected. As reward for what they used to do). [Al-Waqi'a: 22-24]. And Almighty said: (As if they were rubies and coral). [Ar-Rahman: 58]. And He said: (Indeed, We have produced the women of Paradise in a [new] creation. And made them virgins. Devoted [to their husbands] and of equal age. For the companions of the right). [Al-Waqi'a: 35-38]. In Sahih Muslim: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'In Paradise, the believer will have a tent made of a single hollowed pearl, its length sixty miles. In each corner of it, the believer will have family whom the others do not see; the believer will circulate among them. And two gardens whose vessels and contents are of silver, and two gardens whose vessels and contents are of gold. And between the people and their looking at their Lord is only the Cloak of Pride on His Face in the Garden of Eden.' Meaning the attribute of Pride and Greatness; due to His Pride and Greatness, He does not want anyone of His creation to see Him until He permits them to enter the Garden of Eden, then they see Him therein. In Sahih Muslim he said: 'In Paradise there is a market they come to every Friday. The north wind blows and scatters (fragrance) on their faces and clothes, so they increase in beauty and comeliness. They return to their families having increased in beauty and comeliness. Their families say to them: By Allah, you have increased in beauty and comeliness.'

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: In the book of Al-Tirmidhi he said: 'The first group to enter Paradise on the Day of Resurrection, the light of their faces is like the light of the moon on the night of the full moon. The second group is like the most beautiful glittering star in the sky. Each man among them has two wives; on each wife are seventy robes, the marrow of her shank is seen from behind them.' In the book of Al-Nasa'i from Anas, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'The believer in Paradise is given the strength of such and such in intercourse.' It was said: 'O Messenger of Allah, can he bear that?' He said: 'He is given the strength of a hundred.' In the book of Al-Tirmidhi from Ali, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'In Paradise there is a gathering for the Houris with voices the likes of which creatures have never heard. They say: We are the eternal ones who never perish, we are the luxurious ones who never become miserable, we are the pleased ones who never become angry. Blessed is he who belongs to us and to whom we belong.' In the book of Al-Tirmidhi: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'A morning or evening journey in the path of Allah is better than the world and what is in it. And the space of a bow of one of you or the place of his hand in Paradise is better than the world and what is in it. If a woman from the people of Paradise looked at the people of the earth, she would illuminate what is between them and fill what is between them with fragrance. And the scarf on her head is better than the world and what is in it.' In Al-Sahih, Nasif is the Khimar (headcover). In the book of Al-Tirmidhi, the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'The lowest of the people of Paradise is he who has eighty thousand servants and seventy-two wives. A dome is set up for him of pearls, aquamarine, and ruby, as (large as) the distance between Al-Jabiyah and Sana'a.' In the Musnad of Al-Bazzar from Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: It was said: 'O Messenger of Allah, do we have intercourse with our wives in Paradise?' He said: 'Yes, by the One in Whose hand is my soul, a man will have intercourse in one day with a hundred virgins.' From Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'The people of Paradise, when they have intercourse with their wives, they return as virgins.' In Sahih Muslim from Al-Mughira bin Shu'ba, from the Prophet, peace be upon him, he said: 'Moses asked

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: peace be upon him, his Lord: What is the lowest status of the people of Paradise? He said: He is a man who comes after the people of Paradise have entered Paradise. It is said to him: Enter Paradise. He says: O Lord, how? People have settled in their dwellings and taken their portions. It is said to him: Would you be pleased to have the like of the kingdom of a king of the kings of the world? He says: I am pleased, Lord. He says: This is for you and ten times like it, and for you is what your soul desires and your eye delights in. He says: I am pleased, Lord. He said: Lord, then what is their highest status? He said: Those are the ones whose honor I planted with My hand and sealed upon it. No eye has seen, no ear has heard, and has not occurred to the heart of a human.' He said: And its confirmation is from the Book of Allah Almighty: (And no soul knows what has been hidden for them of comfort for eyes). In Sahih Muslim from Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'Allah Almighty says to the people of Paradise: O people of Paradise. They say: At Your service, our Lord, and at Your aid, and good is in Your hands. He says: Are you pleased? They say: Why should we not be pleased, O Lord, when You have given us what You have not given anyone of Your creation? He says: Shall I not give you better than that? They say: O our Lord, what thing is better than that? He says: I bestow My pleasure upon you, so I will never be angry with you after it.' Brothers: Leave the world and strive for the Hereafter. Reject the love of worldly women and buy the luxurious Houris, for they are attained with the easiest prices and will be with you eternally in the Gardens. It is narrated about Malik bin Dinar, may Allah be pleased with him, that he was walking one day in the alleys of Basra. Suddenly he saw a bondwoman of the kings riding with servants. When Malik saw her, he called out: 'O bondwoman, does your master sell you?' She said: 'How did you say, O Sheikh?' He said: 'Does your master sell you?' She said: 'Even if he sold me, would someone like you buy me?' He said: 'Yes, and better than you.' She laughed and ordered him to be carried to her house. He was carried. She entered upon her master and informed him. He laughed and ordered him to be brought in to him. He was brought in, and awe of him was cast into the master's heart.

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: He said: 'What is your need?' He said: 'Sell me your bondwoman.' He said: 'Can you afford her price?' He said: 'Her price with me is two rotten date pits.' They laughed. He said: 'How is her price with you this?' He said: 'Because of her many flaws.' He said: 'What are her flaws?' He said: 'If she does not wear perfume, she smells bad. If she does not use Siwak, her mouth smells. If she does not comb and oil, she gets lice and disheveled. If she lives a little long, she becomes decrepit. She has menstruation, feces, urine, filth, sadness, grief, and troubles. Perhaps she does not love you except for herself, and does not love you except for her comfort. She does not fulfill your covenant, nor is she true in your love. Anyone after you will succeed you over her only to see her as such. And I can take for less than what I asked for your bondwoman in price, a bondwoman created from the essence of camphor, musk, jewels, and light. If her saliva were mixed with the salty sea, it would become sweet. If a dead person were called by her speech, he would answer. If her wrist appeared to the sun, it would darken and eclipse before it. If it appeared in darkness, it would illuminate and shine. If she faced the horizons with her ornaments and robes, they would be perfumed and decorated. She grew up between gardens of musk and saffron, and branches of ruby and coral. She was confined in tents of bliss and fed with the water of Tasnim. She does not break her covenant, nor change her love. So which of them is more worthy of a higher price?' He said: 'The one you described.' He said: 'She is available for a price close to attain in every time.' He said: 'What is her price, may Allah have mercy on you?' He said: 'The easiest spent to attain the hoped-for good: That you empty an hour in your night to pray two Rak'ahs sincerely for your Lord. That your food is placed, you remember a hungry person, so you prefer him for the sake of Allah Almighty over your desire. That you remove a stone or harm (from the road). That you spend your days with sufficiency and little. And lift your concern from the abode of delusion and heedlessness. So you live the world with the honor of contentment and come to the station of dignity safe tomorrow, and descend into Paradise, the abode of bliss, in the neighborhood of the Generous Lord eternally.' He said: 'O bondwoman, did you hear what our Sheikh here said?' She said: 'Yes.' He said: 'Did he speak truth or lie?' She said: 'Rather, he spoke truth, was righteous, and advised.' He said: 'Then you are free for the sake of Allah Almighty. And an estate of such and such is

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: charity upon you. And you, O servants, are free, and an estate of such and such is yours. And this house with what is in it is charity along with all my wealth in the path of Allah.' Then he extended his hand to a rough curtain on some of its doors, pulled it, took off all he was wearing, and covered himself with it. The bondwoman said: 'There is no life after you, O my master.' She threw off her clothes, wore a rough garment, and went out with him. Malik bin Dinar bid them farewell and prayed for them. He took a path, and they took another path. They worshipped together until death came and transported them in the state of worship. May Allah have mercy on them and be pleased with them, and benefit us through them and all the righteous. O Allah, make following them easy for us, deliver to us their openings, perpetuate for us their blessings, join us with them, resurrect us in their group, guide us with their guidance, and make us walk their path. Amen.

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: Seeing Allah, Blessed and Exalted, in Paradise. Allah Almighty said: ([Some] faces, that Day, will be radiant. Looking at their Lord. And [some] faces, that Day, will be contorted. Expecting that there will be done to them [something] backbreaking). [Al-Qiyamah: 22-25]. In Sahih Muslim from Suhayb from the Prophet, peace be upon him, he said: 'When the people of Paradise enter Paradise, Allah Blessed and Exalted says: Do you want anything I should increase you? They say: Did You not whiten our faces? Did You not admit us into Paradise and save us from the Fire? He said: Then the veil is lifted, and they look at the Face of Allah Almighty. They were not given anything more beloved to them than looking at their Lord.' Then he recited: (For those who have done good is the best [reward] and extra). Scholars said: The best reward (Al-Husna) is Paradise, and the extra (Al-Ziyadah) is looking at the Noble Face of Allah Almighty. O Allah, grant us that by Your grace. Imam Ahmad and Al-Tirmidhi narrated from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'The lowest of the people of Paradise in status is one who looks at his gardens, wives, bliss, servants, and couches for a distance of a thousand years. And the most honored of them to Allah is one who looks at His Face Almighty morning and evening.' Then he recited: ([Some] faces, that Day, will be radiant. Looking at their Lord). In the Two Sahihs from Jarir bin Abdullah, he said: 'The Messenger of Allah looked at the moon on the night of the full moon and said: You will see your Lord clearly just as you see this moon; you will not be crowded in seeing Him. If you are able not to be overcome in a prayer before sunrise and before its setting, then do so.' Then he recited: (And exalt [Allah] with praise of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting). In the book of Al-Tirmidhi from

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: Sa'id bin al-Musayyib that he met Abu Huraira and said: 'I ask Allah to gather me and you in the market of Paradise.' Sa'id said: 'Is there a market in it?' He said: 'Yes. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, informed me that the people of Paradise, when they enter it, settle therein by virtue of their deeds. Then they are permitted for the duration of a Friday from the days of the world, so they visit their Lord. He reveals His Throne to them and appears to them in a garden of the gardens of Paradise. Pulpits of light, pulpits of pearls, pulpits of rubies, pulpits of aquamarine, pulpits of gold, and pulpits of silver are set up for them. Their lowest - and there is no lowest among them - sits on mounds of musk and camphor. They do not see that the owners of the chairs are in a better seating than them.' Abu Huraira said: I said, 'O Messenger of Allah, will we see our Lord?' He said: 'Yes. Do you doubt in seeing the sun and the moon on the night of the full moon?' We said: 'No.' He said: 'Likewise, you will not doubt in seeing your Lord. There will remain no one in that assembly but Allah will speak to him directly, until He says to a man among them: O so-and-so son of so-and-so, do you remember the day you said such and such? He reminds him of some of his betrayals in the world. He says: Did You not forgive me? He says: By the vastness of My forgiveness you reached this station of yours. While they are upon that, a cloud covers them from above and rains perfume upon them; they never found anything like its scent. Our Lord says: Rise to what I have prepared for you of honor and take what you desire. So they come to a market surrounded by angels, containing what eyes have never seen the like of, ears have never heard, and has not occurred to hearts. What we desire is gathered for us; nothing is sold therein nor bought. In that market, the people of Paradise meet one another.' He said: 'So the man of high status comes and meets one lower than him - and there is no lowest among them - and he is impressed by the clothing he sees (on the latter). His talk does not end until he imagines upon himself what is better than it. That is because it is not fitting for anyone to grieve therein. Then we return to our dwellings, and our wives meet us saying: Welcome and greetings. You have come, and you possess beauty better than what you left us with. We say: Indeed, we sat today with our Lord the Compeller, and we deserve to return with the like of what we returned with.' Some masters said: I saw a boy in the wilderness standing worshipping, with no one with him, cut off from habitation and people. I greeted him and said to him: 'O youth, you are without helper

book_title: Preparation for Death and the Questioning of the Grave
text: or companion.' He said: 'Yes, by His Might, the Helper and Companion is with me.' I said: 'Where is the Helper and Companion?' He said: 'He is above me with His power, with me with His knowledge and wisdom, before me with His guidance, on my right with His blessing, and on my left with His protection.' He said: When I heard this speech from him, I said to him: 'Would you like company?' He said: 'Far from it! Your company distracts me from His service, and I would not love for this to be mine even if I had the kingdom of the world from its east to its west.' I said to him: 'Do you not feel lonely in this place?' He said to me: 'O you, one whose Beloved and Companion is the Master, how can he feel lonely?' I said: 'Where do you eat from?' He said: 'O you, He who nourished me with His kindness in the darkness of the bowels when small, sponsored me when big. I have a known provision with Him, and it has a decreed time.' I asked him for supplication. He said to me: 'May Allah veil your eye from His disobedience, fill your heart with His fear, and not make you among those occupied by other than Him from His service.' Then he went to leave, so I clung to him and said to him: 'O my brother, when will I meet you?' He smiled and said: 'As for after this day of yours, do not tell yourself of it in the world. And on the Day of Resurrection, a day in which people gather, if you are among those who meet me, seek me in the group of those looking at Allah.' I said to him: 'And how did you know that?' He said: 'My Lord promised me that. That is because I lowered my gaze from looking at prohibitions, prevented my soul from partaking in desires, and secluded myself in His service in the dark nights.' Then he disappeared from me, and I did not see him. O Allah, make us among those characterized by these three qualities so we succeed in meeting You on the Day of Judgment, and among those to whom the keepers of Paradise say when they come to it: (Peace be upon you; you have become pure; so enter it to abide eternally). And may Allah bless our Master Muhammad and his family and companions and grant them peace. Completed with the praise of Allah and His success.
